Alexandria.Albert V. Bryan United States Courthouse: The Albert V. Bryan United States Courthouse is a United States courthouse of the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Virginia located in Alexandria, at 401 Courthouse Square. The structure was built in 1932, and was originally named the United States Courthouse for the Eastern District of Virginia. It was renamed for United States District Court judge Albert V. Bryan on June 26, 1995, by legislation sponsored by Virginia Senator John Warner.
